alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 21 at 9:43AM EST until December 21 at 8:34PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...River flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 941 AM EST, an upstream floodgate release at the Ripogenus Dam is expected to cause minor flooding in the Abol Bridge Campground and along the Appalachian Trail north of Abol Bridge. - Abol Bridge Campground and the Appalachian Trail is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baxter State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
